Reviews.Title: “Not good for tourist at all!!”
Reviews.Author: hiddenman2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good onlyfor meeting not for tourist atall becaz far from mall, taksim, sultan ahmet. Worst option for iranian tourist. Many arab people stay there. Poor breakfast. Price 300 euro/night for double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities, but certainly not a 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: nv1973
Reviews.Content: I would rate the property at 3 star. I was there is low season (March 10-March 18th) and the property was relatively empty! As a result of this, the property had cancelled their shuttle service since the hotel guest count was low according to the manager. They also had reduced room service and cleaning crew, but were charging normal standard rates. There is no concierge at this place. The reception desk is clueless. They send me to two museums on the days that were closed. I should have checked this online first, but learned my lesson on first day. On positive side, rooms are decent size. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at discounted price”
Reviews.Author: Axi13
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel as the company I was visiting has it's office barely 5 minutes away. This is my first stay at this hotel. The hotel is in the commercial district with not many tourist attractions around. The check-in was smooth enough although the reception staff needs some training in English. The bell boys were very enthusiastic and really helped me throughout my stay of 1 week. The rooms are very large compared to other more expensive hotels where I have stayed in Istanbul. They were clean and everything worked well. The wifi was excellent and free. The b'fast and Sultan restaurant were good and food taste good enough. The gym was also quite nice. I didn't try the swimming pool, although I am told that it's heated. There were some small irritations such as room keys not working which meant going down 10 floors again and again. The hotel also has a very large convention centre and a couple of nights were noisy in the lobby. Rooms remained quiet and peaceful though. Overall a good experience, especially at the price of Euro 100/night, which our company was able to bargain. Would recommend for anyone having work in this area.

Reviews.Title: “5 star label, 2 star attitude”
Reviews.Author: Chopchopsee
Reviews.Content: Looks reasonable initially but I would agree with some of the earlier reviews that elude to the lack of service one would normally receive in a 5 star hotel Paid for B+B inclusive; expected an additional room service charge for having breakfast in our room - did NOT expect to pay additional 56TL ie the price of 2 additional breakfasts (which only consisted of 2 mini croissants, a few slices of bread, 2 teas and 2 small glasses of juice) without being told of the additional cost. When I queried the charge, I was asked to put my query in writing; a couple of hours later I was advised it had been refunded and we were sent a bowl of fruit as an apology -well handled I thought . . . On checking out the charge HAD BEEN ADDED BACK ONTO OUR BILL - we were told the manager had decided that it should be added back, but not discussed with us, and was now not available to speak to us! I have stayed in small 2 star hotels that displayed more integrity and class than this place I would never stay here again and would advise anywhere else to be a better place to stay

Reviews.Title: “a really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gj_jeiran
Reviews.Content: its located in sisli area which is quiet and peaceful.the hotel is new and bedrooms are clean and cozy,the bathroom is really nice and the hotel puts cologne , vanity set,and slippers.the tv channel choice is limited but in istanbul nobody stays indoor.reception helps you a lot and you can ask for a ride to metro station at any hour for free,stay there because in istanbul new built hotels are rare!the breakfast is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Runcoa
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, excellent stay. A bit out of centre but ideal for conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hotel-Economy Tariff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru080
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel and I guess I'm starting to like this hotel, though it's not one of the fancy properties that you would come across the globe. The best part of this hotel is that most of the trade-shows, exhibitions, seminars are held here, so staying at the hotel makes sense as the bother of travelling by taxi or any other means of transport is not needed. Savings both money and time...Istanbul traffic can get to your nerves and to add to it the ticking taxi meter. WiFi is free, breakfast is tolerable, staff is courteous( language is a stumbling block) god knows why they have this security check every time one enters and leave the hotel. Overall a good hotel at affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: ldeayton
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and spacious. Bathroom could do with a bit of bleach or new sealant around bath. Reception staff could be friendlier. Wifi is free. Breakfast was fine. I was woken up very early by a large crown of noisey Chinese tourists but thats not the hotels fault. Good value hotel compared to the UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough - We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Grish068
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we first arrived - it was more than we were expecting in terms of first impressions. You do need to go through a little airport security checker, but I don't really see the point as even if you beep they don't check you anyway. Staff were helpful. Drinks and food at the hotel is extorsionately expensive - breakfast is about â‚¬20 per person for just your normal hotel buffet - bread cheeses cereals etc. So would recommend getting food from outside the hotel - and drinks. Don't drink the tap water - or just boil it in the jug in your room. Cab to Taksim Square is about 13TL, and from there you can catch a hop-on hop-off bus around Istanbul. From the hotel, grab a cab to the Grand Cevahir Shoping Mall - costs about 5TL and there is a really big supermarket on the lower level, pharmacy etc. Don't try to walk there as it is not as simple as they tell you it is (it is NOT a 10 min walk like the hotel staff say!!!). If you are leaving from here, the cheapest way to the airport was actually a taxi - I think it cost about 30TL (so if there are two or more of you it is the best price, and easiest), and you can get a taxi outside the hotel at any time of night. Other than that, the room was fine, the aircon was warm, but we just turned it off and opened the window and didnt have any problems. Overall probably one of the best hotels we stayed at in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel, it's not even a 4; maybe a 3...”
Reviews.Author: kris10Paris_France
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but the fixtures and fittings terrible. 1 towel, no shower curtain and lights didn't work (reception told me they had no more towels or light bulbs!) Service can be wonderful or just useless - how much of that was because a lot of staff didn't speak English? That might also be why I got someone elses wake up call at 04h30. The location is inconvenient for just about everything except the petrol station opposite and the windows are that horrible tinted glass that means you can't really tell what colour the sky is outside - it's just a permanent purple/grey. p.s the wireless internet only works when it feels like it ...

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel & Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru080
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as the convention was being held in the same hotel. It really has a very huge convention centre and it makes good business sense to stay in this hotel. All the action is in Taksim square which is a short cab drive from this hotel. Good food, nice cheerful staff.

Reviews.Title: “never to miss istanbul”
Reviews.Author: drparmod
Reviews.Content: drparmod , chandigarh, india i have travelled along with 100 friends for medical conference. the hotel was good though location was away from main part of the city.The city is good ,rather never to be missed from the list of must see places.The hotel and hospitality was average ,though could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Turkey 3days stop over”
Reviews.Author: HenryW3
Reviews.Content: it's great hotel, friendly staff n nice place, clean n comfy bedrooms, we booking two rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amin51
Reviews.Content: It is a very Good hotel in all aspects, we stay there for 7 days, there is a shuttle bus leaving every 1 hour

Reviews.Title: “i LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: alissar
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, very clean and neat rooms, i loved the couches in one corner and the desk on another, the wall paper the windows the furniture, it was perfect. The breakfast was everything to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “an average hotel its not really five star service”
Reviews.Author: mariop79
Reviews.Content: this hotel can get a five star because they have many rooms and also a convention center but in term of service its not really five star,room is ok,breakfast variety is quite good,if you want to go to Taksim Square better avoid the rush hour as it can take 35 minutes to go there by taxi...

Reviews.Title: “Good Bad Ugly !”
Reviews.Author: arahbart
Reviews.Content: the breakfast was perfect ! But , about 200 meter to the first bus station , and 400 meter to the metro , it make you really tired of walking ... the problem is that it is too far from "TAKSIM sq." (about 15 - 20 min ) , and you should know that TAKSIM sq. is where that for every thing you should go there (main bus lines and metro to every where )!!! however room was clean and good, but i think this hotel is 3 star , not 5.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: IntlTrainer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times on business and nothing changes. The breakfast is excellent but that is about it. The rooms are not 5 star - basic, hard beds, no much selection for English TV, and expensive for amenties. The resturant is so so. There are many better hotels to stay at while in Istanbul .

Reviews.Title: “don't bother”
Reviews.Author: manchesterpaul100
Reviews.Content: Checked out the night of arrival. Very tired hotel, very rude staff. depressing bedroom. Went to Novotel instead about 10mins away. This was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful staff, otherwise adequate”
Reviews.Author: breezanne
Reviews.Content: We are staying here for a week-long on-site conference (conducted in English), and have had several odd and frustrating experiences with the staff. At one point, the folks at the "reception desk" were much more interested in talking with one another than in helping guests who were waiting for assistance. Several other times, the staff behind the lobby "sweets" counter were seemingly mystified by guests requesting to buy sweets. One shy fellow didn't know what was in the cakes he was selling, and no labels or prices were visible. On Wednesday morning, one young lady sternly informed me, in very limited English, that if I did buy some baklava, I'd have to eat it at one of her "tables" (there was no way I could keep it for later!). So I just bought some baklava elsewhere, to save for dessert. Overall, we've met many kind and helpful Turkish people, many of whom speak very little English... but these few poorly trained and underinformed staff at a purportedly "International" Hotel and Conference Center do a disservice to Istanbul hospitality. Hotels exist to serve their guests, who usually pay well for this service... and happy guests are pleasant guests, who then can say nice things on Tripadvisor. Otherwise, this hotel is clean and modern, if a bit shiny and hard... the rooms and beds are comfortable, and the water pressure is great... no iron or ironing board... free high-speed internet... nice conference rooms... and the buffets are interesting and mostly tasty (none of us has tried the "chicken breast pudding" dessert yet... but never say never). Istanbul as a whole (and it's a whole lot of city) is certainly a bewitching feast for the eyes and ears and taste buds, with surprisingly compelling shopping opportunities. Purely for pleasure? I'd try another hotel. Conference here? It's convenient, and you'll be comfortable if you stay on-site (Istanbul traffic is tedious and often scary, and taxi drivers are a mixed bag).

Reviews.Title: “Not very "Istanbulish"”
Reviews.Author: Flipendo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cehavir for 3 days, at the 2009 UEFA Cup Final. Is merely a 4 stars hotel. Room: big enough, fair enough, still you'd want some more class. Food: breakfast not very good. Prices: high. Staff: is a business and conventions hotel, so they are pretty bored. Facilities: a lot. Didn't use pool or hammam but wireless internet is free. Location: somewhere near Taksim Place. A huge shopping mall is 15 minutes walking (5 mins with taxi - 3 euros). Over all: good for business, not very good for holyday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to Myself”
Reviews.Author: Diptych
Reviews.Content: A slightly bizarre experience: I had chosen this hotel on the advice of our business partners in Istanbul whose offices are a short walk away. The location is not spectacular; is nowhere near the picturesque part of town, but does have the benefit of proximity to the main road to the airport. The Grand Cevahir is a huge, rather soulless, convention hotel in blocky unattractive concrete but boasts the largest ballroom in Europe and fabulous conference facilities. The problem I encountered was that there was no convention 'in residence' during my visit and consequently the place was completely empty. Absolutely empty. Perhaps if there had been 7,000 dispensing opticians attending their annual conference I would find myself rueing the lack of quiet corners and complaining of the difficulty in getting a table in the restaurant. All I can report for now is that it feels very strange being the only guest in a hotel designed for mass occupation. The place was like a morgue. In terms of facilities I certainly can't complain. My standard room was huge and clean with speedy, free broadband internet access and the gym/health club was well equipped. I didn't eat in the restaurants for fear of agoraphobia. In terms of recommendations I would suggest that they lighten up the reception area (just turn the lights on) and invest in an iron (for non conference periods) or, say, 70 irons (for those, doubtless, happy convention days) so that guests can press shirts and trousers in the rooms (which lack trouser presses).

Reviews.Title: “Typical 5* arab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eng_Pepi
Reviews.Content: This is a typical 5* arab hotel: in an european standard, this is a normal 4* - rooms are OK, service is bad, food is average... One major lack is the fact that most personnel (including reception desk) don't speak anything but turkish... English language is very basic, and when you try to ask something out of the ordinary it is a big mess.. Nevertheless, the stay was very enjoyable - the rooms are big and confortable, good choice of TV channels, excellent internet connection. The breakfast is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: xshayar
Reviews.Content: the worst thing to mention about this hotel is the staff being so impolite and unfriendly,the service is not what you expect from a 5 star hotel. the security check at the hotel entrance makes you feel like a criminal and not a guest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cevahir
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the hotel with my wife and son. The hotel itself is a good one. Clean and tidy. I didn't have enough time to stay in the hotel and use its facilities. It have an interior and exterior swimming pool, turkish bath, Sauna, and gym center. Overall it is a good one, not very far away from interesting places

Reviews.Title: “not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: trichter
Reviews.Content: together with my wife I spent a weekend after a business trip in Istanbul. The staff at the front desk was totaly stressed during our check in , as a rusult they gave us a wrong room key and so we were surprised to see two woman on (our) their room. After getting our room we asked housekeeping for additional vacuumcleaning because the carpet was pretty dirty. They said they would do but they never came...The staff especially in the breakfast restaurant was very unfriendly. There is no kind of service you would expect in a five star hotel. Our ranking is max three stars Thomas Richter, Germany

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Cevahir Hotel and Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: Darulaceze Sokak No. 9 Sisli, Istanbul, Turkey
